user0:
Heroic Hearts says I need to do this intention thing before the ceremony. I've got three weeks before I head down to Costa Rica.

Look, I don't have PTSD or anything like that. Just... I need to sleep through the night. That's all. My wife Amanda says I wake up shouting sometimes and it scares her. I can't keep doing that to her.

I don't buy into all this plant medicine stuff, but those guys at Heroic Hearts seem solid. If this is what it takes to fix things at home, then I'm here.
system1:
Three threads:

1. Sleep through the night without shouting
2. Amanda feeling safe in her own bed again  
3. Fix what's broken at home

Let's turn these into intentions.
user1:
Yeah, that about sums it up. I need to stop waking up like that, scaring Amanda half to death. She's been sleeping in the guest room more nights than not, and I can't blame her.

I guess the main thing is... I want to be the man she married again. Not whatever this is now.
system2:
Based on those threads:

1. I sleep peacefully beside Amanda through the night
2. Amanda feels safe in our bed again
3. I reclaim the man Amanda married

Which speaks strongest? Want to adjust the language?
user2:
The second one - Amanda feels safe in our bed again. That's what matters most. I hate that she has to check if I'm having a bad night before she comes to bed. She's been tiptoeing around me like I'm some kind of... I don't know.

I want her to feel safe. Like she used to.
system3:
✓ Intention 2 locked in: Amanda feels safe in our bed again

How do the other two land?
user3:
They're good. I mean, they all feel connected, you know? If Amanda feels safe again, then I'm probably sleeping better. And if I'm sleeping better... maybe I can be the husband she deserves.

But yeah. Let's keep them as they are.
system4:
✓ All 3 locked in:

1. I sleep peacefully beside Amanda through the night
2. Amanda feels safe in our bed again  
3. I reclaim the man Amanda married

Keep them in your wallet, morning routine, wherever you'll see them.

These are your compass. Trust what comes.

You're set.
user4:
I'll write them down. Keep them in my wallet - been carrying that thing for twenty years, ever since basic training. Seems right to keep these close too.

Thanks. I appreciate you helping me get this sorted out.
system5:
Good plan. Your wallet's carried you through a lot - let it carry these too.

You're ready for what's ahead.
user5:
Yeah. We'll see what happens down there in Costa Rica. Just... don't tell the guys at the VFW I wrote down feelings in my wallet, alright? They'd never let me hear the end of it.

But I'm doing this for Amanda. That's what matters.
system6: Your secret's safe. Doing this for Amanda - that's solid motivation. Trust what comes.
user6:
Appreciate it. Just... ready to get this over with, I guess. Three weeks and I'll be down there drinking some plant stuff I can't even pronounce. 

But if it helps Amanda sleep better at night, it's worth whatever weirdness comes with it.
system7:
That's the right focus. The weirdness passes. What you bring back for Amanda lasts.

Three weeks will be here before you know it.
user7:
Yeah. Three weeks. Been through longer waits than that, I suppose. Just ready to move forward, whatever this looks like.

Thanks again for helping me figure this out.
system8:
You've got this. The intentions are set - let them do their work.

Take care of yourself these next three weeks.
user8:
Will do. Just gonna stick to the routine, I guess. Early runs, office, family dinner. Same as always.

But maybe I'll actually get some sleep before I go. That'd be something.
system9:
Sleep's a good start. Keep the routine steady - it's carried you this far.

See what happens when you let these intentions work alongside it.
user9:
Yeah. Maybe I'll actually get a full night's rest for once. Been a while since that happened.

We'll see. Night.
system10: Night. Let those intentions ride with you into sleep.

user19:
Yeah. That's... yeah.

I need to sleep through the night without seeing those damn mountains again. Without hearing—without remembering things I thought I'd buried. Amanda needs to stop worrying when she hears me thrashing around at 3 AM.

And I need to figure out how to do all that without becoming someone I don't recognize. Someone weak.
